intro: Clibadium erosum, commonly known as the rough sida, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions of the Americas. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes cotton and hibiscus, and is characterized by its hairy, rough-textured leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are typically clustered in inflorescences, and it is often found in disturbed soils and along roadsides.
